html:
The documentation for ZITADEL comprises two major subject areas:

  1. Manuals for users, support organisations and administrators.
  2. Technical resources for developers and integrators.

Please be reminded that ZITADEL is open source — and so is the documentation. Should you happen to stumble over an incorrectness, a spelling mistake, a hard-to-understand text passage, please don’t hesitate to leave a comment or propose a corresponding change.

metadata.title: Introduction
metadata.description: This is the place for all things ZITADEL. Whether you are a developer, an integrator or a user of ZITADEL, then the following pages are written for your referral.

html:
• Be transparent about you decisions
  • Stateless Application design
  • System of records is the eventstore
  • Everything else need to be able to be regenerated
  • Try not so solve complex problems outside of the IAM Domain
  • Use scalable storage for the eventstore and querymodels
  • Try to be idempotent whenever possible
  • Reduce necessity of system or external dependencies as much as possible
  • Embrace automation
  • Design API first
  • Optimize all components for day-two operations
  • Use only opensource projects with permissive licenses
  • Don't roll your own crypto
  • Embrace standard as much as possible
  • Make use of platform features
  • Be able to run with a CDN and WAF
